# Call for Papers: IPCCC 2025

The 44th IEEE International Performance Computing and Communications Conference (IPCCC 2025) is a premier conference presenting research in the performance of computer and communication systems. For over four decades, IPCCC has been a research forum for academic, industrial, and government researchers.

## Conference Details

*   **Conference Name:** 44th IEEE International Performance Computing and Communications Conference (IPCCC 2025)
*   **Location:** Austin, Texas, USA
*   **Dates:** November 21 – 23, 2025
*   **Virtual Conference:** November 15, 2025
*   **Website:** http://ipccc.org

## Submission Types

All papers should be submitted at [https://edas.info/N33767](https://edas.info/N33767). The following types of papers are accepted:

*   **Regular Paper:** 8 pages without extra charge, and up to 2 extra pages at $100 per extra page.
*   **Short Paper:** 6 pages without extra charge, and up to 1 extra page at $100 per extra page.
*   **Poster Abstract Paper:** 2 pages. No extra pages are available. Posters are encouraged from students to present their work in progress.

# IPCO 2025: Call for Papers

The 26th Conference on Integer Programming and Combinatorial Optimization (IPCO 2025) will be held at **Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore, Maryland, USA**, from **June 11-13, 2025**. A Summer School will precede the conference on **June 9 - 10, 2025**.

## Scope

IPCO is a forum for researchers and practitioners working on various aspects of integer programming and combinatorial optimization. The aim is to present recent developments in theory, computation, and applications. The scope includes algorithmic and structural results, computational studies, and novel applications of discrete optimization to practical problems.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission deadline:** November 4, 2024, 23:59 AoE
*   **Notification:** January 22, 2025
*   **Final versions for proceedings:** March 25, 2025
*   **Poster abstract submissions:** April 13, 2025
*   **Summer school:** June 9 - 10, 2025
*   **Main conference:** June 11- 13, 2025

## Submission Guidelines and Instructions for Authors

Authors are invited to submit an extended abstract for a **double-blind reviewing process**.

*   **Format:** Submissions must be formatted in LaTeX using the **Springer LNCS style**. They can have a maximum length of **12 pages**, plus references and an optional appendix.
*   **Appendix:** An appendix containing additional technical material and full proofs can be added for consideration by the program committee and will not be published in the proceedings.
*   **First Page:** Should contain the title and a short abstract.
*   **Introduction:** Must be a broadly accessible exposition of the main ideas and techniques used to achieve the results, including motivation and a clear comparison with related work.
*   **Reviewing Criteria:** Papers will be reviewed based on the quality and originality of the research, plus its interest to people working in the field. The importance of the work must be clearly understood, and claimed results must be correct and new.
*   **Exclusions:** Papers will not be considered if they have already been published, are under review by a journal or another conference with proceedings, have a member of the Program Committee among their authors, or are submitted after the deadline.
*   **Anonymity:** Submissions should not reveal the identity of the authors. Names, affiliations, and email addresses should not appear in the submission, and authors should refer to their own work in the third person.
*   **Submission Server:** [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ipco2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ipco2025)
*   **Adherence to Guidelines:** Papers failing to adhere to the guidelines risk rejection.

## Best Paper Award

IPCO will present a **Best Paper Award**, chosen by the Program Committee.

## Call for Posters

IPCO 2025 will feature a poster session and a best poster award on **June 11, 2025**.

*   **Welcome:** Posters from Ph.D. students and postdocs are particularly welcome.
*   **Submission Format:** A PDF file, one letter-size page maximum, one-inch margins, 11-point font, single-space.
*   **Deadline:** April 13, 2025.
*   **Contact:** Please contact Amitabh Basu at [basu.amitabh@jhu.edu](mailto:basu.amitabh@jhu.edu) for any questions.

# ISAGA 2025: Call for Contributions

+++ Call for contributions closed +++

Thank you for over 100 contributions on a big variety of S&G related topics. We are sure that together we will create an unforgettable conference.

## Theme: "Shaping the Future" through Simulation and Gaming

In a world where uncertainty looms large, simulation and gaming provide us with powerful tools to explore, experiment, and envision the future. Whether it is modelling the impact of climate change, predicting market trends, or designing urban landscapes, simulation and gaming empower us to shape a better tomorrow. Let’s discuss the opportunities and challenges of “shaping the future” through simulation and gaming.

### Content Focus:

Submissions on topics with the following focus are particularly welcome:

*   Artificial intelligence, big data and automation
*   Augmented and virtual reality
*   Sustainability and climate change
*   Resilience and adaptability
*   City and spatial planning, infrastructure use or development (transport, energy, water…)
*   Urban planning and public participation
*   New work and organisational development
*   Society in transition
*   Innovative social work
*   Lifelong learning and future skills
*   Future-oriented learning and teaching in schools, universities and other institutions
*   Research on facilitation and evaluation
*   Innovations in the public sector
*   National and international conflicts
*   Dealing with crisis and disaster management

These future topics can be considered from a wide variety of simulation and gaming aspects, including new games and methods, areas of application, facilitation, evaluation, etc. General submissions on simulation and gaming are also welcome.

## Types of Contributions

We look forward to receiving numerous submissions and a lively participation in our conference. You can submit entries for the following categories. All submissions will be subjected to a quality check and assigned to suitable presentation formats. The online submission portal opened on October 15, 2024: [Link to the online submission portal](https://www.conftool.org/isaga2025/index.php?page=login)

### Scientific Papers

*   **Description:** Present qualitative or quantitative empirical research and discuss findings. Submissions that offer background research, literature reviews, or theoretical analyses on specific topics are also welcome.
*   **Presentation:** Oral presentation during an interactive paper session.
*   **Theme Alignment:** Highly encouraged.
*   **Submission:** Full and short papers covering mature results or early work.
*   **Publication:** All papers will be peer-reviewed double-blind. It is planned to publish excellent short and long papers in Springer Lecture Notes after the conference. Publication channels are subject to change.
*   **Requirements:**
    *   Papers must be written in English.
    *   Papers shall be about **6-15 pages** including abstract, figures, tables, and references.
    *   Abstracts must be within **150-250 words**.
    *   Paper format must follow the **Springer LNCS format**. (more information here)
    *   Please submit your papers in anonymised form via Conftool.

### Best Practice Papers

*   **Description:** Focuses on contributions with a high practical approach, including experience reports, best practice case studies, and other submissions that provide guidance and inspiration for practical applications in the field of gaming and simulation.
*   **Presentation:** Oral presentation during a paper session.
*   **Attendance:** At least one of the authors must attend the conference.
*   **Publication:** Selected papers will be published in English in the ZMS publication series.
*   **Requirements:**
    *   Papers must be written in English.
    *   Papers must be about **4-15 pages**, including abstract, figures, tables and references.
    *   Abstracts must be within **150-250 words**.

### Posters

*   **Description:** Work and ideas at an early stage can also be submitted as posters. During the conference, there will be an opportunity to present the posters and to engage with the conference participants.
*   **Submission:** Abstracts (300-600 words) are required for submission and acceptance as poster presentations.
*   **Attendance:** At least one of the authors must attend the conference.
*   **Recommendation:** Based on reviews, papers not accepted for presentation may be recommended to be included as a poster presentation.
*   **Proposal Requirements:**
    *   A summary detailing the topic from **300 up to 600 words**.
    *   Please include the design, the activity and how it involves participants.

### Workshops

*   **Description:** Interactive events centered on a certain topic, issue or game. They are collaborative and active, not mere presentations. Facilitators invite participants to actively work on a topic or design artefacts or focus on the design, play an exploration of games. They involve participants in hands-on exploration and creation.
*   **Duration:** Organizers may request either **60 or 90-minute** time slots.
*   **Theme Alignment:** Welcome submissions that resonate with the conference theme.
*   **Proposal Requirements:**
    *   The name(s) of the workshop organizer(s).
    *   A summary detailing the topic from **300 up to 600 words**.
    *   Please include the design, the activity and how it involves participants.

### Outside the box

*   **Description:** A format for anyone who is thinking sideways! Dealing with the future means being open to new ideas. That’s why the ISAGA Conference 2025 has the ‘outside the box’ category. Any submissions that cannot be assigned to the classic types of submissions are welcome here. Do you have creative ideas that go beyond classic presentation and workshop formats (i.e. a small game, a new method, a warmup, …)? Then this category is for you!
*   **Proposal Requirements:**
    *   The name(s) of the organizer(s).
    *   A summary detailing the topic from **300 up to 600 words**.
    *   Please explain the design, including the time frame and spatial requirements and involvement of attendees.

## Deadlines

All submissions should be submitted using the conference management system Conftool: [Link to Conftool](https://www.conftool.org/isaga2025/index.php?page=login)

# Call for Papers - IEEE/ACM International Symposium on Mixed and Augmented Reality (ISMAR) 2025

## Overview

ISMAR 2025 will host a single track for papers and include a revise and resubmit phase, strengthening the rebuttal opportunity. The conference will cover industry and research activities related to the full range of immersive technologies (AR, MR, and VR), including everything from interfaces in the real world to fully immersive experiences and beyond.

We invite contributions that advance all aspects of AR / MR / VR technology and user experiences.

## Paper Submissions

This year, there is one submission deadline for a unified review process for both the IEEE TVCG journal and the conference-only papers. The possible outcomes of this unified process are:

*   Accept as IEEE TVCG paper, with presentation at ISMAR 2025
*   Accept as IEEE ISMAR 2025 conference paper, with presentation at ISMAR 2025
*   Recommended as IEEE ISMAR 2025 poster.
*   Reject

Submissions accepted as journal papers will be directly published in a special issue of IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics (TVCG). Submissions accepted as conference papers will be published in the conference proceedings of ISMAR 2025. All accepted papers will be archived in the IEEE Xplore digital library.

Submissions may be **4-9 pages** with an additional 2 pages of references. A paper abstract must be uploaded prior to the actual paper submission deadline. All paper submissions must be in English and left blind for review. Accepted papers will be granted an oral presentation and may have the opportunity to present as a demo.

## Important Deadlines

*   **Abstract deadline:** **April 4th, 2025** (23:59 AoE, Friday)
*   **Paper submission deadline:** **April 11th, 2025** (23:59 AoE, Friday)
*   **Workshops:** **May 2nd, 2025** (23:59 AoE, Friday)
*   **Tutorials:** **May 9th, 2025** and **May 16th, 2025** (23:59 AoE)
*   **Doctoral Consortium:** **June 9th, 2025** and **June 30th, 2025** (23:59 AoE)

*   **Poster Papers:** **July 29th, 2025** (23:59 AoE, Tuesday)
*   **Demos:** **July 29th, 2025** (23:59 AoE, Tuesday)

## Review Process

The review process will have two cycles under a single submission deadline:

### Review Cycle I (Submission to Initial Notification)

Submissions will be assigned to two members of the ISMAR 2025 International Program Committee (IPC). Submissions that violate the submission guidelines will be desk rejected. Those that are not desk rejected will receive at least three full reviews.

Based on reviews and discussions, the Program Chairs will make one of the following initial recommendations:

*   **Revise and Resubmit:** These submissions will go through a second review cycle. A revise and resubmit recommendation does not guarantee acceptance.
*   **Reject:** Authors may resubmit rejected papers to the poster track.

### Review Cycle II (Revision with Rebuttal to Final Decision)

Authors will have time to revise their submissions and write a rebuttal. The revised submission and rebuttal will be reviewed, leading to a final recommendation by the committee.

# ISSAC 2025: Call for Papers

The International Symposium on Symbolic and Algebraic Computation (ISSAC) is the premier conference for research in symbolic computation and computer algebra. ISSAC 2025 will be held from **July 28th to August 1st, 2025**, at the **Center for Research in Mathematics (CIMAT) in Guanajuato, Mexico**.

## Conference Topics

All areas of computer algebra and symbolic computation are of interest at ISSAC 2025. These include, but are not limited to:

### Algorithmic aspects:

*   Exact and symbolic linear, polynomial and differential algebra
*   Symbolic-numeric, homotopy, perturbation and series methods
*   Computational algebraic geometry, polynomial and semialgebraic optimization
*   Computational group theory and number theory, quantifier elimination and logic
*   Computer arithmetic
*   Summation, recurrence equations, integration, solution of ODEs & PDEs
*   Symbolic methods in other areas of pure and applied mathematics
*   Complexity of algebraic algorithms and algebraic complexity

### Software aspects:

*   Design of symbolic computation packages and systems
*   Language design and type systems for symbolic computation
*   Data representation
*   Considerations for modern hardware
*   Algorithm implementation and performance tuning
*   Mathematical user interfaces
*   Use with systems such as digital libraries, courseware, simulation and optimization, automated theorem-proving, computer-aided design, and automatic differentiation.

### Application aspects:

*   Applications that stretch the current limits of computer algebra algorithms or systems, use computer algebra in new areas or new ways, or apply it in situations with broad impact.

## Submission Instructions

### Regular Papers

*   ISSAC 2025 invites the submission of original research contributions. Papers must be in English and should not exceed **8 pages** in the ACM two-column style. An additional 2 pages may be used for bibliographical references and/or experimental results, data, or code.

### Software Presentations

# Call for Papers - Research Track

ISSRE (International Symposium on Software Reliability Engineering) is the leading conference on software reliability, focusing on approaches, techniques, and tools for assessing, predicting, and improving the reliability, safety, and security of software systems.

## ISSRE 2025 Key Features

*   **Early Decisions:** ISSRE 2025 introduces an early decision system. Authors will be notified of an "Accept", "Reject", or "Response Recommended" outcome at the beginning of the author response period, reserving author responses for cases with specific reviewer inquiries.
*   **Transparency and Reproducibility:** Authors are encouraged to disclose data and submit artifacts to the Artifact Evaluation (AE) track to enhance reproducibility and quality, potentially earning credibility badges.
*   **Physical Presentation Requirement:** At least one author of every accepted paper is required to make a full author registration and present at the conference physically in São Paulo.
*   **Special Issue Invitation:** Authors of accepted papers will be invited to submit an extended version of their work to a special issue of the Empirical Software Engineering (EMSE) journal.

## Submission Categories

ISSRE 2025 invites high-quality submissions in the following categories:

1.  **Full research regular (REG) papers:** Describing a novel contribution to the reliability of software systems, with clear evidence and validation.
2.  **Practical experience reports (PER) papers:** Exposition of practical experiences, lessons learned, or empirical studies, including negative results.
3.  **Tools and artefacts (TAR) papers:** Presenting new tools or substantial extensions to existing tools, or software and experimental data sets.

## Important Dates (AoE)

*   **Abstract submission deadline:** April 28, 2025 / May 5, 2025
*   **Paper submission deadline:** May 5, 2025 / May 12, 2025
*   **Early decisions:** June 30, 2025
*   **Author rebuttal period:** June 30th - July 6th, 2025
*   **Notification to authors:** July 18, 2025
*   **Camera ready papers:** August 19, 2025

## Paper Categories and Lengths

*   **REG papers:** 12 pages (including references).
*   **PER papers:** 12 pages (including references).
*   **TAR papers:** 6 - 10 pages (including references).

Papers exceeding the page limits will be rejected without review.

## Topics of Interest

Topics include development, analysis methods and models throughout the software development lifecycle, and are not limited to:

*   Dependability attributes (i.e., security, safety, maintainability, survivability, resilience, robustness) impacting software reliability
*   Reliability threats, i.e. faults (defects, bugs, etc.), errors, failures
*   Reliability means (fault prevention, fault removal, fault tolerance, fault forecasting)
*   Software testing and formal methods
*   Software fault localization, debugging, root-cause analysis
*   Metrics, measurements and threat estimation for reliability prediction and the interplay with safety/security
*   Reliability of autonomous systems and (self-)adaptive systems
*   Reliability of AI-based systems, AI for Reliability Engineering
*   Reliability of Large Language/Foundational Model (LLM) and LLM for software reliability
*   Reliability of software services and Software as a Service (SaaS)
*   Reliability of model-based and auto-generated software
*   Reliability of open-source software
*   Reliability of software dealing with Big Data
*   Reliability of green and sustainable systems
*   Reliability of mobile systems
*   Reliability of software within specific technological spaces (e.g., Internet of Things, Cloud, Semantic Web/Web 3.0, Virtualization, Blockchain, networks softwarization, 5G/6G, edge-to-cloud computing)
*   Normative/regulatory/ethical spaces about software reliability
*   Societal aspects of software reliability

## Anonymizing Rules

Authors must anonymize their papers by:

1.  Removing authors' names and affiliations from the title page.
2.  Removing acknowledgements of identifying names and funding sources.
3.  Using care in naming files (source file names are often embedded).
4.  Referring to related work, particularly your own, in the third person. Avoid omitting references.
5.  If citing anonymous work, send deanonymized references to the PC chairs via email.
6.  Authors may use a non-anonymized version for other purposes but must not mention submission to ISSRE 2025.

Submissions violating formatting and anonymization rules will be desk rejected.

## Formatting Rules

*   Submissions must adhere to the IEEE Computer Society Format Guidelines using the provided LaTeX/Word templates.
*   Each paper must be submitted as a single Portable Document Format (PDF) file with embedded fonts.
*   The first page must include the title and a maximum 200-word abstract.
*   Figures and graphs should be readable in grayscale.
*   Symbols and labels in graphs should be readable when printed.
*   Limit file size to less than 15 MB.
*   Authors are encouraged to supply source code and raw data for reproducibility.

## Paper Submission

*   Papers are submitted via Easychair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=issre2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=issre2025)
*   Submissions will be reviewed via a double-blind process. Papers with non-disclosure agreement forms will be rejected.
*   Changes in author numbers/order are not allowed after acceptance.
*   Submissions violating formatting and anonymization rules will be desk rejected without review.

## Review Process and Author Response

Reviews will be made available to authors before the PC/Board meeting for factual error correction. Responses should be concise and focus on reviewer concerns. The new "Early Decisions" system will categorize papers as "Accept", "Reject", or "Response Recommended" early on, reducing the need for responses in many cases.

## Awards

*   **Best Research Paper Award:** Awarded annually to the best paper in the Research Track.

## Conference Proceedings

The conference proceedings will be published by IEEE Computer Society Conference Publishing Services (CPS), submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore and A&I partners.

## IEEE Policies

All submissions must adhere to IEEE Conference Publishing Policies and will be screened for plagiarism through the IEEE Cross Check portal.

# ISSTA 2025: Call for Papers

The ACM SIGSOFT International Symposium on Software Testing and Analysis (ISSTA) 2025 invites high-quality submissions, from both industry and academia, describing original and unpublished results of theoretical, empirical, conceptual, and experimental research on software testing and analysis.

## Submission Types

ISSTA invites three kinds of submissions:

1.  **Research Papers:** Describing original contributions in testing or analysis of computer software. Papers describing original theoretical or empirical research, new techniques, methods for emerging systems, in-depth case studies, infrastructures of testing and analysis, or tools are welcome.
2.  **Experience Papers:** Describing a significant experience in applying software testing and analysis methods or tools, with carefully identified and discussed lessons learned for the community.
3.  **Replicability Studies:** Encouraging the replication of results from previous papers, going beyond simple re-implementation. These studies should clearly describe their purpose and value beyond the original result, and will be evaluated based on depth and breadth of experiments, clarity of writing, appropriateness of conclusions, actionable insights, and availability of artefacts.

## Publication

**NEW THIS YEAR:** The conference proceedings will be published in the Proceedings of the ACM on Software Engineering (PACMSE), Issue: ISSTA 2025.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Originality:** Submissions must be original and not previously published or under consideration elsewhere.
*   **Page Limits:**
    *   Research Papers, Experience Papers, and Replicability Studies: Maximum 18 pages for text and figures, plus 4 pages for references.
*   **Formatting:** Use the ACM SIG Proceedings templates:
    *   LaTeX: Use `\documentclass[acmsmall,screen,review,anonymous]{acmart}`.
    *   Word (Mac/Windows)
*   **Layout:** Single-column page layout.
*   **Submission Site:** Papers must be submitted electronically through the [ISSTA 2025 submission site](https://issta2025.hotcrp.com).
*   **Categorization:** Experience papers and replicability studies should clearly specify their category in the paper title upon submission (e.g., "[TITLE](Experience Paper)").

## Review Process

*   Each submission will be reviewed by at least three members of the program committee.
*   Submissions will be evaluated based on originality, importance, soundness, evaluation, presentation quality, comparison to related work, and verifiability/transparency.
*   Final decisions are made by the program committee as a whole.

## Double-Anonymous Reviewing

ISSTA 2025 will conduct double-anonymous reviewing. Authors must ensure their submissions do not reveal their identity, including names, affiliations, and self-citations (use third person for referring to own work).

## Open Science Policy and Data Availability

ISSTA adopts an open science policy to foster transparency, reproducibility, and replicability.

*   Authors are encouraged to disclose anonymized and curated data and/or source code via supplemental material or a link to a repository.
*   At least one reviewer will check provided data.
*   Sharing data is not mandatory but will inform the committee's decision.
*   Papers must include a section named "Data Availability" after the Conclusion, stating the availability (or lack thereof) of data and code.
